item.description:
***Topic of Talk and Discussion***

Eating seasonal local foods is beneficial to your health and helps keep your body in balance. Eating locally produced foods reduces your environmental impact through reduced transportation costs and helps boost the local economy. We will discuss the benefits to your health as well as strategies to increase the amount of local seasonal foods you are eating.

***About our speaker***

Maria B. Mayer is a Certified Health Coach. She decided to become a health coach to fulfill her passion of working with people to improve their health and life. After seeing how lifestyle changes positively impacted her and her husband’s health she wanted to share this with others.

Maria received her training at The Institute for Integrative Nutrition in New York City. In 2011 she completed a Certificate in Plant Based Nutrition from Cornell University. Prior to starting her training specific to nutrition, Maria earned a bachelors degree in Psychology from Boston University and a Masters degree from the University of Connecticut.

Maria leads workshops on nutrition and offers individual health and nutrition coaching.

Check out Maria's website:  http://www.mariabmayer.com/

***************************************

Schedule for the evening:

7:15 pm: Delicious Potluck Dinner begins.

7:45 - 8:30 pm: Talk and Discussion about “How to Eat More Seasonal Local Food”

8:30 pm - 9:30 on: Hanging out and clean up

About the potluck dinner:

-Many people have dietary restrictions. Be mindful as you prepare your dish, and list the ingredients on a note card at the event.

-This a zero-waste event. Please bring your own plate and utensils.

***************************************

FREE PARKING! In the back of the ArtSpace building. Ignore "Resident Parking Only" signs. Parking is allowed during this event. Enter through the back entrance by the murals.

***************************************

This event is organized by CT Health Foodies, a supportive, dynamic community for people interested in healthy eating. We organize monthly potluck dinners and talks on the second Tuesday of the month at ArtSpace in downtown Hartford.
item.how_to_find_us: Enter through the back entrance by the murals. Walk down the long corridor. At the end of the corridor, on the right, you will see the room where we will be meeting.
item.name: Talk on "How to Eat More Seasonal Local Food" & Healthy Potluck Dinner
